summary: This bill, the Mid-Atlantic River Basin Commissions Review Act, mandates the Comptroller General of the United States to review the Mid-Atlantic River Basin Commissions (Susquehanna, Delaware, and Potomac). The review, to be completed within a year of the Act's enactment, will assess ethics, public communication, federal responsibilities, funding sources, potential overlaps with other authorities, and reporting practices. Following the review, the Comptroller General will submit a report with findings and recommendations to relevant congressional committees. The commissions will then be required to submit compliance plans annually for five years.
